item.title: like facebook ?
item.description:
like facebook ?

,

Similarly.. why not use the facebook like button next to your posts ? Again we head back to the developer section to get the next set of code.

,

It looks very similar to the comments set up :

,
<div id="fb-root"></div>
<script>(function(d, s, id) {
  var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
  if (d.getElementById(id)) return;
  js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
  js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_GB/sdk.js#xfbml=1&version=v2.10";
  fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));</script>
,

and..

,
<div class="fb-like" data-href="https://social.abc-xyz.us" data-layout="button_count" data-action="like" data-size="large" data-show-faces="true" data-share="true"></div>
,

The same rules apply as we used with the comments box, this time we can make the embedded html window a lot shorter, set it to 30.

,

item.title: lets start with facebook..
item.description:
lets start with facebook..

,

At the end of this post, you‚Äôll see that we have the facebook comments box embedded into our grid site.. You can get the code for the plugin here, but once you have it you can basically reuse it again and again on your sites..

,,

The code that facebook gave me is :

,
<div id="fb-root"></div>
<script>(function(d, s, id) {
  var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
  if (d.getElementById(id)) return;
  js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
  js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_GB/sdk.js#xfbml=1&version=v2.10";
  fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));</script>
,

and..

,
<div class="fb-comments" data-href="https://social.abc-xyz.us" data-width="800" data-numposts="5"></div>
,

They say to add the larger code block once on your page just after the <body> tag, and the single line of code can be placed anywhere on your website that you want the comments box to appear.

,

We don‚Äôt have access to the <body> tag but each embedded html window that we add to the site reacts as tho it‚Äôs an own page anyway. So we‚Äôll add it everytime we want the comments box.

,

On the single line of code, facebook wanted to know in pixels how wide the plugin should be. Because we want it to work on the Homepage, maybe on it‚Äôs own page, and also for visitors that maybe on a mobile phone, we can change that ‚Äú800‚Äù to ‚Äú100%‚Äù.

,

Also note the data-href. It‚Äôs ok for the first comments box on a page, but if you add a second comments box, you need to change the url. I normally just change it to the posts url. Otherwise we‚Äôll end up just replicating the same comments through out the site on every comments box we have. ie they won‚Äôt be unique. Lastly the size of the comments area is upto you, but we‚Äôed suggest setting the embedded window to about 400.

,

So here is the actual code we pasted in the embedded html window, and the result below. Leave a comment and let us know what you think.. üòä

,
<div id="fb-root"></div>
<script>(function(d, s, id) {
  var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
  if (d.getElementById(id)) return;
  js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
  js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_GB/sdk.js#xfbml=1&version=v2.10";
  fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));</script>
